contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=June 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist |name = Bill Leeb |image = |caption = |background = solo_singer |birth_name = Wilhelm Anton Leeb |alias = Bill Leeb, Wilhelm Schroeder |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1956|9|21|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Vienna]], [[Austria]] |origin = [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]] |instrument = |genre = [[Industrial music|Industrial]], [[electronic music]] |occupation = Singer, Composer, Writer |years_active = 1984–present |label = [[Nettwerk Records]]<br />[[SPV GmbH]] |associated_acts = [[Skinny Puppy]]<br />[[Delerium]]<br />[[Front Line Assembly]] |website = }} '''Wilhelm Anton "Bill" Leeb''' (born 21 September 1956, [[Vienna]], [[Austria]]) is an [[Austrian people|Austrian]]-[[Canada|Canadian]] [[electronic musician]]. He moved to [[Kitimat, British Columbia|Kitimat]], [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]] with his family when he was 13. He was a [[high school]] [[student]] at [[Mount Elizabeth Secondary School]]. Leeb began his musical career with [[industrial music|industrial]] [[band (music)|band]] [[Skinny Puppy]] under the [[pseudonym]] of '''Wilhelm Schroeder''' in 1985, contributing [[bass synth]] and occasional [[backing vocalist|backing vocals]] to a few of their [[sound recording and reproduction|recordings]] and [[concert]]s from this period. He left in mid 1986 and formed his own industrial project [[Front Line Assembly]] with Michael Balch, and later [[Rhys Fulber]] and Chris Peterson. Though Front Line Assembly has had consistent underground success, Leeb's most widely known efforts are through his side project, [[Delerium]], which had a major [[hit record|hit]] in the late 1990s with "[[Silence (song)|Silence]]".<ref name="Huey">{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p97476/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography: Bill Leeb|last=Huey|first=Steve|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=3 July 2010}}</ref> Musical projects in which Bill Leeb has participated in include: *[[Front Line Assembly]] *[[Delerium]] *[[Synæsthesia (band)|Synæsthesia]] *[[Cyberaktif]] (with [[cEvin Key]] and [[Dwayne Goettel]]) *[[Noise Unit]] *[[Intermix (band)|Intermix]] *[[Equinox (electro-industrial band)|Equinox]] *[[Skinny Puppy]] *[[Fauxliage]] Leeb lives in [[Vancouver]], British Columbia, Canada. His ex-wife, [[Carylann Loeppky]], created much of the [[album cover|artwork]] for his [[gramophone record|records]] over the years. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Front Line Assembly}} {{Delerium}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{Persondata | NAME = Leeb, Bill | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Wilhelm Schroeder | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Singer | DATE OF BIRTH = 21 September 1956 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Vienna, Austria | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leeb, Bill}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Canadian electronic musicians]] [[Category:New Age musicians]] [[Category:Austrian emigrants to Canada]] [[Category:People from Vienna]] [[Category:Skinny Puppy]] [[Category:Musicians from Vancouver]] [[Category:Canadian people of Austrian descent]] [[Category:Canadian industrial musicians]] [[Category:People from Kitimat, British Columbia]]
